IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: PROVIDE FOOD, SHELTER, CLOTHING, AND ESSENTIAL SERVICES TO THE COMMUNITY'S HUNGRY AND HOMELESS.
IRS990.MissionDesc: IN COLLABORATION WITH THE PEOPLE OF MISSOULA AND SURROUNDING AREAS AND LOCAL, STATE, AND NATIONAL ORGANIZATIONS, THE POVERELLO CENTER, INC REACHES OUT TO PROVIDE FOOD, SHELTER, CLOTHING, AND ESSENTIAL SERVICES TO THE COMMUNITY'S HUNGRY AND HOMELESS. THIS MISSION IS ACCOMPLISHED THROUGH COMPASSIONATE, RESPECTFUL, AND COMPETENT SERVICES IN AN ENVIRONMENT THAT ENHANCES HUMAN WORTH.
IRS990.Desc: THE POVERELLO CENTER, LOCATED AT 1110 WEST BROADWAY IN MISSOULA, MONTANA, HOUSES SERVICES FOR TEMPORARILY HOMELESS CLIENTS. THE SHELTER PROVIDES 95 EMERGENCY BEDS, WITH 24 HOUR ACCESS TO SHELTER AND SERVICES. SERVICES PROVIDED FREE OF CHARGE IN THE SHELTER INCLUDE: BREAKFAST, LUNCH, AND DINNER, AS WELL AS ACCESS TO SACK LUNCHES, STORAGE SPACE FOR PERSONAL BELONGINGS, COMPUTERS, PHONE, MAIL, BUS PASSES, SHOWERS, LAUNDRY FACILITIES, CLOTHING, RADIP INTAKE AND REFERRAL, AND AN ON-SITE PARTNERSHIP HEALTH MEDICAL CLINIC. IN 2015, "THE POV" PROVIDED 155,304 MEALS AND 47,628 NIGHTS OF SHELTER TO 1443 UNDUPLICATED INDIVIDUALS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: HOUSING MONTANA HEROES PROVIDES 26 BEDS IN OUR BROADWAY FACILITY FOR HOMELESS VETERANS. THIS PROGRAM PROVIDES VETERANS UP TO 24 MONTHS OF SUPPORTIVE HOUSING, INCLUDING ON-SITE CASE MANAGEMENT, PREPARED MEALS, 24-HOUR A DAY SUPPORT STAFFING, AND ACCESS TO PARTNER AGENCIES AND COMMUNITY SUPPORTS THAT WILL ASSIST THEM IN TRANSITIONING FROM HOMELESSNESS TO A MORE PERMANENT HOUSING SITUATION. THE PROGRAM IS LOCATED ON A SECURE WING AND HAS A SEPERATE COMMUNITY ROOM, BATHROOM AND LAUNDRY FACILITIES.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: THE VALOR HOUSE PROVIDES 17 INDIVIDUAL APARTMENT UNITS TO PREVIOUSLY HOMELESS VETERANS, IN A NON-DORMITORY TYPE SETTING, ONSITE CASE MANAGEMENT, 24-HOUR STAFFING, AND AN ABUNDANCE OF LOCAL AREA HEALTHCARE PROVIDERS TO HELP AID VETERANS AS THEY TRANSITION OUT OF HOMELESSNESS AND CREATE STABILITY FOR THE FUTURE. THE PROGRAM IS CONSIDERED LONG-TERM TRANSITIONAL HOUSING, WHERE QUALIFIED RESIDENTS CAN LIVE FOR UP TO 24 MONTHS, AND WITH A MINIMUM 12 MONTH STAY. DURING THEIR STAY AT VALOR, RESIDENTS PAY 30% OF THEIR INCOME AS RENT. AFTER ONE YEAR IN THE PROGRAM, A VETERAN IS ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE A SECTION 8 HOUSING VOUCHER TO ATTAIN THE HOUSING OF THEIR CHOICE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PROVISIONS FOR INCOME TAXES HAVE NOT BEEN RECORDED IN THESE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS BECAUSE THE POVERELLO BELIEVES IT HAD NO INCOME UNRELATED TO ITS EXEMPT PURPOSES IN 2015 OR 2014. WITH FEW EXCEPTIONS, THE POVERELLO IS NO LONGER SUBJECT TO U.S. FEDERAL OR STATE TAX EXAMINATIONS BY TAX AUTHORITIES FOR YEARS BEFORE 2012.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part III, Line 4d: Other Program Services Description
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES 4: THE POVERELLO CENTER'S OUTREACH PROGRAM WORKS TO IDENTIFY BARRIERS TO HOUSING/SERVICES FOR MISSOULA'S CHRONICALLY HOMELESS INDIVIDUALS, WHILE SIMUTANEOUSLY SUPPORTING AND EDUCATING DOWNTOWN BUSINESSES AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS. THE TEAMS CONDUCT DAILY OUTREACH TO INDIVIDUALS LIVING ON THE STREETS AND IN ENCAMPMENTS ACROSS THE COMMUNITY.PROGRAM GOALS:-BUILD RELATIONSHIPS WITH SHELTER-RESISTANT INDIVIDUALS THROUGH DIRECT CONTACT.-IDENTIFY BARRIERS TO SERVICES AND MAKE REFERRALS TO AREA RESOURCES. -DETER USE OF COSTLY EMERGENCY SERVICES BY PROMOTING THE H.O.T. LINE AS AN ALTERNATIVE TO 9-1-1 FOR DISRUPTIVE BEHAVIOR RELATED TO CHRONIC HOMELESSNESS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11b: Form 990 Review Process
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 WILL BE THOROUGHLY REVIEWED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS' FINANCE COMMITTEE AND WILL BE APPROVED BY THE TREASURER PRIOR TO SIGNATURE BY THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15a: Compensation Review & Approval Process - CEO, Top Management
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR COMPENSATION WAS DETERMINED BY DOING COMPARISONS WITH SIMILARLY STRUCTURED AND SIZED NON-PROFITS THROUGH THE MONTANA NON-PROFIT ASSOCIATIONS COMPENSATION GUIDE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 18: Explanation of Other Means Forms Available For Public Inspection
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS FORM 1023 AND FORM 990 AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19: Other Organization Documents Publicly Available
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.

IdRelatedTaxExemptOrgGrp.PrimaryActivitiesTxt: HOLD AND DEVELOP PROPERTY FOR POV CENTER
